intro: Campbellia cytinoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian whitebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
